name: Disable RSS, RDF, and Atom Feeds
author: Ataurr

sections.description:
The “Disable RSS, RDF, and Atom Feeds” plugin allows you to disable all RSS, RDF, and Atom feeds easily on your WordPress website. This plugin provides options to redirect feed requests to the corresponding HTML content or issue a 404 error. You can also allow the global post and comment feeds if desired.

This plugin is handy if you do not use RSS feeds and want to reduce your site’s exposure. It prevents unauthorised users from accessing your site’s content via feeds.

Features

Disable all feeds: RSS, RDF, and Atom.

Options to redirect feed requests or issue a 404 error.

Allow global post feed and comment feed.

Integration with bbPress to disable forum/topic/reply feeds.

Simple configuration through WordPress settings.
sections.installation:
Upload the plugin files to the /wp-content/plugins/disable-rss-rdf-atom-feeds directory, or install the plugin directly through the WordPress plugins screen.

Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ screen in WordPress.

Go to Settings > Reading to configure feed settings.
sections.faq:
Can I allow some feeds while disabling others?

You can allow the global post and comment feeds while disabling all other feeds by configuring the settings.

What happens when a feed request is made?

You can redirect feed requests to the corresponding HTML content or issue a 404 error.
sections.changelog:
1.1

Updated plugin name and text domain.

Added options to control feed redirection or issue 404 errors.

Improved compatibility with bbPress feeds.

1.0

Initial release.

short_description: Disable all RSS, RDF, and Atom feed on your WordPress site with the option to control behaviour such as redirection or issuing a 404 error.

upgrade_notice.1.1: Please update to enjoy better control over feed redirection and improved compatibility with bbPress.
